resp.text: Thank you for your kind comments.

name: Bethany Robertson
text: I had the best experience at this store a few days ago. Sundy went above and beyond to help me. Gave me advice on what I should do about my return that I had for Amazon. I will definitely be using their services again and again!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your kind words.  We shared your comments with Sundy and were glad we were able to help you through the Amazon return issue you encountered.
Thank You,
Larry

name: Eliza Collier
text: Very Rude Customer Service!!...The woman UPS employee there today yelled RUDELY at everyone saying there should only be 7 people waiting in line(there was 6 she admitted) after making others go outside. But that’s not the worst part...she refused to help process people’s returns at the empty computer station while the line proceeded to get 12 people deep outside down the sidewalk....leaving only one employee taking everyone’s returns because she refused to help. Very Rude & Stressful environment!

resp.text:
I do apologize and will discuss this with her.  Looking at the video I believe she was trying to clear some of the packages from the area as it was getting too congested given the run of people they saw during that period.  In between that period she was helping customers at the other computer.  I will discuss this with her, She should have let you and the other customers know what she was doing, such as "I need to clear the area and will get back to everyone as quickly as possible."
Thank You,
Larry

name: M
text:
I have to say that I am extremely disappointed with how this location is handling the COVID safety of its patrons. I went in yesterday to drop off a package. They were swamped and it was a 45 minute wait. The wait was not the issue. It's December and I expected there to be a wait. The issue was that there was no social distancing encouraged in the small lobby space! There were 13 people crammed in a small area at one point + employees. There was one employee not wearing a mask at all. She kept walking around in the front area and making trips out the front door through the crowds of people. Another had on a 3" chin visor mask, that let's be honest, wasn't protecting anyone. As someone that is high-risk and being very careful about being around people, this was an incredibly uncomfortable (but unfortunately necessary) trip to the UPS store for me.  The gentleman behind me also expressed how uncomfortable he was with the thought of having to step inside the lobby with so many people. In fact, we both hung back and allowed people to filter out before going inside, only to have many more people cram in behind us just moments after we walked in.

We've been at this pandemic thing for months. Concern for safety is not new. Why was there no one at this location telling people, "So sorry guys, only 5 allowed inside at a time so we can keep everyone safe."  Not to mention the fact the if I have to wear my mask to enter the building, WHY are employees not required to wear proper masks as well?

resp.text:
I am sorry that you had a bad experience.  We have signage on the door requesting our customers to maintain social distancing while in the store as well as placards on the floor spaced ~6 ft apart to aid in the effort to maintain social distancing.  We had hoped that these aids would have been sufficient for our customers to self police.  During the remainder of the holiday season and as needed we will begin having someone at the door to help our customers to maintain the proper social distancing during our busiest periods.  I will review our store video to see which of the employees did not have a mask on and take the appropriate actions.

Thank You and I do Apologize
Larry Stephens

name: PAB “Kelfer” Brown
text: Absolutely RUDE!   Went in to have a 1 page document notarized, called the day before to confirm a notary would be there, we were told the employees name and she would be in.  Upon arrival that employee was up front and said she was busy and was the only one working and we would have to wait, (just to note when we first walked in we were the only customers) but OK. A few customers did come in for shipping, we waited.  Another woman came out from the back and told us there was no time and we would have to come back tomorrow, we said we would just await until there was time and she said NO we had to come back, I said the other employee asked us to just wait...the woman who said NO was described as the "owner" and handled the situation in an extremely rude manner.  the apparent owner said this has to be done by appointment I told her I did call yesterday and was told the notary was working...that didn't matter.  No where on website does it state this service is "by appointment". We were not in a rush and were willing to wait for the shipping customers to be dealt with first.  We had a one page document, literally took another notary in the area 7 minutes time.   POOR BUSINESS model to treat customers so rudely.

resp.text:
Sorry for the bad experience on Sunday.  We do only have one person working Sundays after the first hour or two there is not much activity.  Because of the one person and that some notaries can take a good amount of time we do ask our employees not to refer any notaries to the Sunday person but we did and we should have honored that when you came in.  Especially since yours was an easy one.  I am sorry and have spoken to those involved.  We will make every attempt to honor a notary when a person walks in.
Thank You,
The Other Owner
Larry Stephens

name: Paige Williams
text: This store is always on it!! The employees are so sweet and helpful, Sundie is very patient and gets you out quick! Each time I’ve come there’s been a long line, even reaching the door, and I’ve still never spent longer than 5 mins in there. Cannot complain!

resp.text:
Thank you for your kind words.  I will pass them on to Sundy and the staff.

Larry Stephens

name: Alishua Rikard
text:
Even though my package has been lost. I’m still
Giving them a 5 star rating. Manager handled the claim well, expressed it would take awhile, still isn’t resolved but they are doing all they can. Every time I have emailed I have gotten a reply, if I call the manager gets on the line. Can’t complain really some things are a process. I hate waiting but it happens, thanks for the amazing customer service even in a bad situation.

name: zoila Frye
text: Yesterday i visited this store to Fax some papers. I was very disappointed in the way the associate that helped me was treated by her manager and management.  She was helping and doing all she could when the managerment came from the back and was very disrespectful to her in front of several customers. I now understand why the hiring sign is posted on door. If i was treated in this matter i would have walked out. The managerment there needs a attitude check. I will never grace this store again. Respect is a must to me when it comes to customer service and this management team earns none.

resp.text:
Ms Frye,
Thank you for your comments.  I do apologize for the events you witnessed and ask for your forgiveness.  I will also meet with the employee and apologize to her as well.
Thank You,
Larry Stephens

name: Jim Taylor
text: I have to frequent this store often to drop off packages being shipped from the company I work for. I feel so bad a lot of times because I have so many heavy and awkward boxes but every time I come in the entire staff is always so friendly. I really appreciate all of them being so nice. I’ve been in the shipping business for over ten years and it can be a headache at times so I understand and relate to what they all go through at times. Great store and great customer service!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Mr. Taylor.

name: Shelly Bates
text:
Horrible.  Notary did not fully complete her part.  Had to have document notarized again and this store refused to acknowledge fault and charged for another notarization.

However, the man who works there is very nice and always helpful. I can’t say that about the lady that works there.  She is rude and seemed annoyed that she had to notarize a document.

resp.text:
Sorry Ms. Bates for the bad information you received.  I know we talked this morning regarding the problem.  I have talked to our employee on this issue.  As discussed, we will be glad to take care of this and fix the paper work at no charge.  Please come by at your convince and ask for Larry.

Thank You,
Larry

name: Rance Czermak
text: This location is rude in that if you mess up on printing cause they don't show you how things work on their printers they will still charge you. This is not customer service and they need to understand that the mess up is with the customer service here.

resp.text: Sorry you had a bad experience.  Please call me and let me have more details on what happened.  I will be glad to fix or refund.  Ask for Larry 256-766-9843.

name: Rachel Brown
text: Two workers gave each other looks of anonnoyance the entire time I was in the store trying to ship a return for the first time. It was very uncomfortable. I wasn't holding up the line, telling anyone who walked in to please go around while I tried to figure things out. Eventually just left after the way those two ladies made me feel.

resp.text:
Ms. Wolf,
I am sorry they made you feel uncomfortable.  We want to be there to help as much as we can.  One of the girls was fairly new and was shadowing the other.  I will have a talk with the everyone to let just know of this situation and come up with ways to avoid this in the future.  I apologize and thank you for your comment.

Larry Stephens
256-766-9843

name: Amanda Moore
text: Kind staff, good location.

name: Burgess Fox
text: Staff is always helpful and goes above and beyond to help me out. I always come forgetting something like tape or my return label and they are quick to assist!

name: craig lee
text: I like the owner she is sweet but she has a hard time getting good help.I have been there on Sat and no one opened until 10am a hour late.But its the only UPS shipping in Florence now that the Mailing room closed.

name: Jo Larson
text: Stay away. Very rude employees.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear of your bad experience with us.  I will speak to our staff.  I would like to hear more about what happened so I can take more detailed actions with myself and our staff.  If you will call me at 256-766-9843 my name is Larry, or email us at store6145@theupsstore.com we would appreciate it.  Thank you.

name: Jody Olivent
text: They always try to up charge me no matter what I'm shipping and they always say the "must do xyz or we can't ship it". The most recent incident they outright refused to ship my items. Once informed that I have shipped the same thing from multiple other UPS Stores they call there national hotline. The person on the other end tells them my item is OK to ship. They then try to sneak in a $15.50 "additional handling fee" on each box. I'm told it is because of what I'm shipping. I've never been charged that fee by UPS or any of their other stores for the same items.

name: Donna Craig

We value your business and hope you will give us another try soon.

I feel bad because I take just about any package, including USPS, I can now to ship there since they are convenient and effective.  Great service every time.

resp.text: Thanks for shopping with us

name: z k
text:
Avoid for custom card printing services! Staff are friendly and responsive,  but it seems they have no experience or training in using any of their computer software ... even the resident "graphic artist". The graphic artist wasn't attentive at all to the clear descriptions I had in my email for what I wanted, and it seems the computer itself may be unable to handle the graphics software requirements.

After emailing my images and card descriptions, and feeling very positive about the response I received, I arrived to check on the test prints. They were terrible. The original image had been completely changed - apparently a misunderstanding from the email, but I can't see how someone could interpret it so wildly different. I said nothing about changing my own images.

I had a secondary image I wanted on the back of the card, and for some reason the staff stretched the image out of shape and also completely redid the text in the image for no reason. Let me be clear that the image was a jpg format so, to redo the text, the staff had to take it upon themselves to either cut it out from the image and warp it into its new position, or plaster new text on top of it and resave as a new jpg - not at all a simple, trivial mistake. I mentioned this as I watched the staff work with it at the computer, and it was clear they didn't know what "aspect ratio" was, or how to resize anything to maintain the aspect ratio, and they also kept working with the bad version they'd redone, instead of the original one I wanted.

It seems the only print software they "know" how to use is the standard Windows photo printing interface. If you've ever used this yourself, you know it's as simplistic as you can get and not the best software for sizing and placing images exactly where you want them, unless you know what you're doing. The staff did not know what they were doing, even to print the right things on the right sides of the paper. And this was the software they wanted to use to size and place images on paper to create my card. What kind of professional printing service uses the barebones Windows software to print ANYTHING??? This is not creative software! This isn't even appropriate printing software unless you're desperate or want only the most simplistic results. Utterly embarrassing.

After several minutes of watching the staff stretch and squeeze my image in one program, fail to print at the right size via Windows print, and then try to open up another program supposedly to edit further (and fail because the computer simply wasn't going to open the program), I decided I could do better at home. I also learned that even though the staff said I could provide the text for the inside of the card and they would pick the font and arrange it for me (as you do when you're a print shop), this is an extra charge of something like $10. I was told that if I wanted to save that extra charge, I needed to format the words and everything myself and save it as an image, so the sum total of their responsibility would be printing images and not messing with text. I was also told that if they had to resize any of the images (like they were trying and failing to do) that was also a charge of $10. What graphic artistry does that entail? Who knows. Resizing images is also par for the course for printing cards, and should be free, along with arranging text. But it's not, so YOU need to do all the leg work by making sure your images are the "right size" for printing ahead of time. That's right, your jpg on the computer must be sized at 5 inches ahead of time, by yourself, to print on a 5 inch card. Nevermind that the print shop is in the best position to actually control the physical print size and all you should need to do is send a high quality image.

Paper choices are run-of-the mill and nothing special. Will never print anything here for any reason.

To be clear, I don't blame the staff; they did their best. I blame the owners. Train your people. You let them and your customers down.

resp.text: My name is John hasan and as the owner of this small business, this is not what I like to hear at all. I sincerely apologize you had a poor experience. Please know that I am taking your feedback to heart and plan to provide ongoing training for our staff to increase our print expertise. I hope we have the opportunity to make it up to you in the future.

name: Ashish Patel
text: The owner was nice and cleared up the issue I had with the employee there. Will do business again.

resp.text: Thanks Ashish for understanding

name: Kayla Hagan
text: The sales associate,  while nice,  kept trying to pressure me to purchase the "before Christmas delivery guarantee ".... I came in on the 17th, and unsure how a package going straight up I-65 would take longer than 8 days to get there. She was hesitant on telling me other price/delivery options. I understand sales, but it is ridiculous trying to worry people on sending packages in a timely manner, and have them repeatedly ask for delivery options, especially when they are on a tight budget. I was informed by the recipient that they received the package today... so thank you for delivering the package in a timely manner, but no thanks for the ridiculous hassle to send it.

resp.text:
Hey Kayla,
I hate to hear that you felt pressured and that you felt like the associate was hesitant to give you the ground option. I think that they just wanted to make sure that you knew that yes even though there was 8 calendar days until Christmas, UPS only had 5 shipping transit days left and we can't predict when or if ground volume will be affected.

So again I'm sorry to hear about your experience but I am glad to hear that your package got there quickly.

Also, she should be mindful about following people to their car to continue trying to explain her invalid point.
Edit: in Regina’s response, she states she carried my trampoline to the car. She did not, one of her male associates carried it. Also, I waited 30 mins and Regina said she was a packaging expert but I should continue to wait for her husband to return to find a box for it to fit in. Waiting 30 mins is not me being in a rush, this was my SECOND attempt at getting a box at this location. I can’t believe she would blatantly lie. After 30 mins and her following me to my car, I went to Saraland and was able to get my box packaged within 5 mins. I have a positive review posted there.

name: BJ Blackwell
text: Terrible experience in every way.  I was simply trying to get some documents notarized and I completely felt like I was in the twilight zone.   They charged me $70 UPFRONT before the notary service was complete without an invoice or any service fee chart so I knew what I was paying for AFTER I had to leave and come back because I had signed the “non-notarized” documents before I got there and had to go back to Office Depot to reprint the 36+ pages.  The owners wife (at least I think she was) was loud and rude to at least 3 of the customers while I was there (including me) over their face mask and another guy a signed document and seemed like she was on something based off of her demeanor and disposition.   The same thing happened to another customer while I was there as she quickly and loudly yelled “IT’S ILLEGAL SIR!!” because his document he had was signed in a “non-notary” place with more than 5 customers in the business.   I was embarrassed for them, the young employees that were being trained that this is classified as customer service, and myself for sharing the same air as these total and complete morons.

resp.text: Mr. Blackwell - We would like to apologize for your negative experience at our store.  I'd like to learn more about your specific situation and make things right. text: This store is by far the worst I have ever stepped foot in. Ran by a husband and wife. If the husband would admit the wife into a retirement home for crazy people and keep her out of this store he would surely see a extreme increase in revenue.

name: Noell Espaillat
text:
I am so thankful to Kenzie and Aysha for their help today! I went to another postal carrier and they wanted to charge me $170 per package for a $25 little blanket! So I left and went to the UPS store and they were so nice and helpful and I shipped both packages and got a book of stamps for less than $50!
On top of meeting my needs, they were very nice and helpful. Thank you ladies! I should have seen you first, this is my only stop from now on!

resp.text: Noell, it was truly a pleasure to serve you!  We would really like to see you again.  Please let us know if there's anything we can help you with.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed your visit at The UPS Store 2350 and took time to leave a Google review!  Sincerely, Regina Rasool - Owner, The UPS Store

name: Lotus
text: Went to this location to ship a very small package that was going to Poland. I was on my lunch break and was pressed for time. I waited patiently as the clerk attempted to try to figure out how the address should be input it into her system. It ended up taking about 15 minutes or so for this process. There was really no problem with this, even though it was inconvenient. However, the employee then stated you're probably not going to want to ship this once you know how much the prices to which I responded while how much is it, and she stated give me a couple of minutes and I'll tell you. I found this quite interesting as she obviously knew what the price is going to be. She ended up quoting me over $190 for the shipment!! Again one hundred and ninty dollars!.. Keep in mind that this package was about 6"x5"x2".. A very small package. She then proceeded to tell me that USPS would charge me $95 for the package. I looked at her and asked if she was joking.. No, she was not. I quickly grabbed the package and left the store. I drove over to USPS down the road and went in to have the package shipped. The total cost for priority mail ended up being $32.50. Moral of the story, this place is a huge rip-off with very inflated pricing and should not be used under any circumstances for international delivery. They obviously cannot be trusted and do not know how to correctly price and ship packages. Avoid this location, or any third-party UPS package store for that matter. Just stick with either handling it online and using it as a drop-off source or avoid it altogether.

name: Paul Thompson
text: I would give more than 5 stars if I could. Amazing customer service. I had some packages arrive on a Saturday that I was unable to pick up that I needed before my flight the next day.  I left a message on their phone and they allowed me to pick them up over 3hrs after they closed on the weekend. I have done business there before and will continue to do so in the future.  They owners who helped me were super nice.

resp.text: Thank You, Mr. Thompson.  We were happy to help you in your time of need.

name: Ellen Carter
text: I have dealt with this store for 6 years. They are family owned and operated, so they are able to provide personal service. I have sometimes been a pain in the neck customer, forgetting to bring an address or something. They will let me go ahead and leave my package and call in the address... They have held my mail for extended periods when I have been traveling... They have looked through my mail for certain deliveries for me when I have called to request that... They have even checked my amazon email for me to do a return.... Way above the average customer service. I am very glad they are there for me.

resp.text: You are so sweet, Ms. Carter!  We enjoy seeing you in our store, so don't worry.  You are no trouble to us at all!  Anything we can do to help, we'll continue to do for you.

name: Greg Hoffmann
text:
I am super impressed with the top notch customer service and the kindness of the staff at this UPS store.
This is a busy store but they always do a great job at moving things along as quickly as possible.
I would recommend this UPS store anytime!

resp.text: Thank you, Greg!

name: Michael Burke
text: Very kind and patient staff, who assisted me with my unusual predicaments with accepting and returning items over the holidays. Not sure what issues these others are reporting, perhaps just dissatisfied with UPS-wide pricing and practices.

resp.text:
Thank you so much, Mr. Burke.  If there is anything you ever need help with, please let us know.
Sincerely, Regina Rasool, Owner-The UPS Store.

name: jin lim
text:
Tried to drop off a package with a return label from something I bought online. They said it is not proper packaging and wouldn't let me drop it off. That's a lie. It was the same packaging that I received it in so that can't be improper packaging. It was literally a ups box.  They are just trying to make money from repackaging items. I guess the UPS business isn't doing so well.  There is a reason there are so many bad reviews.

edit: Owner is lying in response.

resp.text: Online businesses who ship boxes to customers do not ship using UPS branded boxes.  These boxes are exclusive for The UPS Store Franchises and affiliates only.  I am sorry for your experience, whatever that might have been.  If it was my store that you visited and had this experience, it is quite possible your box was either badly damaged or was devoid of the proper amount of packaging materials and we merely suggested that you add packaging materials.  We work hard to assure that our customers packages are packed and shipped the way we would ship our own personal packages.  If any customer is having an unpleasant experience at any UPS location, please ask to speak to the owner or manager and they will gladly be able to resolve any situation, as we never want our customers to leave unhappy.   R. Rasool, Owner, The UPS Store #2350

name: Pamela Ramos-Brown
text:
All of my experiences have been pleasant and professional.  The owners, including the family members, and the staff have been very accommodating, courteous, and genuinely friendly.

On more than one occasion they have gone above and beyond to help.  It's a great place for personal and business mail and other office services.

resp.text: Ms. Ramos Brown, I hope you are doing well.  I just wanted to take a minute to tell  you how much your positive review means to us.  It is customers like you who help us to feel positively about running a business in these hard times.  The owners

name: Aaliyah Dang
text: KENZIE IS THE BOMB DOT COM. I DEMAND HER A RAISE AND THAT’S PERIOD! She was SO helpful while I was looking hella lost! Best UPS store Everrrrr!!

resp.text: Thank You So Much, Erica.  You made our day! Owners, The UPS Store

text: Best UPS store in town!! Very clean, has great customer service and is open later than all the others. Owners are very hospitable and really do care about their customers. I dont know what other people are talking about...I will not go to any other UPS store after visiting this one!

name: Marc Lichtenberger
text: I went in to get a document notarized.  Guy made it impossible to sign a one page document.  Wanted to see other documents in escrow package that had nothing to do with the grant deed.  He was not rude though and was professional up to the point where I thought he was being overly intrusive.

name: John H
text:
Wow, this is proof that people are more likely to say something if they have something negative to say. I am an eBay seller and I have been going to this UPS Store weekly for the past 3 years and I never thought once to leave a positive review. That says it all.

The owner is super nice and he is an extremely hard worker.  In fact 1 day I came in with a bad attitude and he took the "high road" remaining calm and professional. I have regretted it ever since. As for the shipping errors, we are all human and things happen, but if this was really a problem I would know. After all, I have shipped out over a hundred items from this location with literally no issues.

I wish some of the reviewers on here would revisit their ratings. For example, 1 review said there experience was "bordering on the unfavorable" but then they left a 1 star rating. How is that possible? It also made me sad when I read the 1 star review left b/c they were upset that the workers tried to sell them their services. Please reconsider this review. They are running a business and everyone's got eat. Thanks!

resp.text: Mr. John, when reading your review from several years ago, I feel a great sense of appreciation for you taking your valuable time to write such a considerate and detailed review.  I agree with everything you have said in your review.  I hope you are doing well and we hope to see you again in the future.  The owners

Every time we have to pick up, there is some sort of problem - or they are very put out because we are asking for our package.  Most of the time things are delayed.  The staff here has been a rotating door, so usually they have to get a manager involved to answer simple questions.  Management team is incredibly rude and very condescending - to their employees and customers.

Unhelpful, rigid staff.  Today...”I cant allow you to (use our stapler or seal) your envelope package in our store.  It is against UPS policy.” But they could sell me a “self sealing envelope for $3.50.”
Every time I have to do a simple transaction with
they manage to irritate me beyond belief.

She made us incredibly uncomfortable and was insensitive to the situation at hand. I have filed a complaint with ups and although she is the wife of the owner, I hope to have her removed from the store. The lady she "helped" in front of us, left upset as well. This woman does not need to be customer service. Ever.

Very disappointed and upset they set me back by a few days to a week and they really don't care at all I don't recommend this store plz don't be fooled by the management they will set you or your small business back and hustle you too I guarantee!!!

text: I asked to email the file to be printed and he said ok. Then wanted to charge me a fee to check his email to print the documents. I do this at other UPS stores FedEx Office Staples and Office Depot/Max and have never been cherry a fee for them printing from their email. I walked out.

text:
If you live alone and have no access to picking up your package, nobody is allowed to pick it up for you, which is total bs. How are single people supposed to get their stuff if they're never home and have nobody "eligible" living at their address to get it? Totally biased and unfair. They want you to pay again for reshipment. A bunch of jerks.

And mediocre costumer service.

text: Staff is helpful and very friendly.

Regina Rasool, Owner

name: Judy Williams
text:
It's a shame when you have to call the police over $7, in order to get a business owner to do what is right by the customer.

I must first say this: Not once did I raise my voice (I lost my voice so I am vocally incapable of yelling) or curse at him.

Incident: I got a POA document notarized by Razuel on Saturday, and mailed it the same to Nationwide. Nationwide Collison Manager said via email that the document was not acceptable by DMV because additional information was written on the document by Raquel. On Wednesday I return to the store and speak with his wife "G" and explain what happened and show her the email copy indicating the mistake. She states that this particular document does not require "for _ only" and instructed me to come back and they will redo it for Free. Today, 9/20, I go in speak with Raquel, catch him up on my conversation with his wife. His reason for not redoing was because nationwide rep was not present in store with me and it would be illegal for him to do so. I request a refund for his document error. At first his stance was services were rendered because the dicument has been accepted in the past and its his principles (whatever they were). Finally we agree that he should issue a refund. He soon changed his mind and after I suggested him and his wife get on one accord with the policy and look into new notary standards. Razuel ordered me to leave because I should just be quiet (his words). I obviously refused and called the police instead.
A refund was eventually issued after the police arrived, however not before Razuel allowed his pride to dictate his moral code.

Customers are in the business of donating funds to your business. Yes, you should be accountable for rendering services properly.

name: nancy newman
text: 0 stars.....have been twice recently. The owners are rude, the place has a horrible odor and there is NO customer service. Only objective from these people is to mae more $ off of you. Repackaging (and charging Comcast/vendor) when in boxes sent straight by them. Sending an item to Amazon in the same box it as delivered in and insisting it had to be repackaged or he 'wouldnt take responsiblity'. Did i want to buy tape and do it? $$$ every little bit he can gouge helps him. Then when i was leaving he was a smart aleck. Never will i step foot in this place again HORRIBLE!!!!!

text: Hours are not open until 7pm. This place closes at 630.  So don't rely on Google or ups fir this information. Bad

resp.text: Ms. Lambert, this UPS Store has been closing at 7:00 p.m. Monday through Friday for at least the past 4 years.  You are mistaken about this UPS Store closing at 6:30 p.m. The only time we have ever close early is if a severe storm would put our employees at risk when traveling home, which is very rare.  We are open 9:00 am to 5:00 p.m. on Saturday and we are closed on Sunday.  I would like to give you the opportunity to reach out to one of the owner's and/or consider revising your review. text: I recently had worked with the UPS store here in Homewood, AL on a project with a client of mine. text: I've never had a bad experience at this place. The staff has a good customer service attitude, they're always prompt to provide assistance, and I never feel like I'm a bother to them. They seem genuinely eager to help. Recommended.

text: Got a weird racist vibe from here. I was waiting for like 5 min in the front of the store (store was empty) to drop a few boxes then a worker walked by and looked me dead in the eye and said nothing just walked to the back of the store.(probably cuz I was speaking Spanish lol )  If it wasn’t for the young man that works in front I would never come back.. too bad he wasn’t there today. He’s the only reason I gave this review 2 stars

resp.text:
Juan,
I'm sorry you had a bad experience at our store.  We do our best to make every customer's experience a good one.   I can assure you there is no problem with you speaking Spanish. Sincerley,

text: This place just tried to charge me $5 to run off 1 black and white piece of paper. My biggest mistake was coming period. This is exactly why UPS continues to be a joke!

resp.text:
Mr. Burchfield:  I'm sorry your experience did not meet your expectations.  When you were in and said you wanted to email us a document to print, I asked how many pages (1) and if it was black and white (yes).  I offered you a $2 alternative to the email, which was to log on to our wi-fi, and print the document to our wi-fi printer instead of the $5 email charge.

Sincerley,
Mark Berthiaume
Manager

name: Brielle Deloris
text: When I entered the facility the staff seemed apprehensive to help customers who walked through the doors. I sent a package overnight for next day delivery and my package was never sent from this specific location although this is the location I took my package too. I paid for overnight service for something that was never sent and I had to open and investigation for my package. I’m disappointed in my first and last experience with UPS. I’ll stick to FEDEX.

resp.text:
I don't show a shipment from our UPS Store with the name of Brielle Deloris.  Could you supply me with the tracking number so I can research the shipment in question.  There is one NDA shipment sent recently that a customer came into our store to ask some questions about.  I'm not sure if that is the shipment you are referencing or not, but I would be glad to have a dialogue with you regarding your shipment.
Sincerely,
Mark Berthiaume - Manager

name: David Rogers
text: They provide great service for printing. I send them a file that I need 100 copies printed and cut and almost always they are done by the end of the business day. Absolutely great service.

text: Ive printed a lot of my restaurant's manus and promotions with this store. They always do a great job!

name: Londa Wren
text: Great staff always friendly!!

name: Tom Windsor
text: Keith and his staff are top notch. Outstanding customer service. No need to look anywhere else for all of your printing and shipping needs. They even have a convenient notary public service that I have personally used. Keep up the great work!

text: They are a great local business-copied my blueprints with skill and courtesy. When first set was too light they repeated until I was satisfied. Work was done quickly and efficiently while I waited. Cost was reasonable also.

text: I received a package ordered from Amazon that was open and only 1 item in it when I had ordered 2. It was Closys mouthwash. The UPS store was not responsible for this.  They’re store is only for drop offs.  They are very kind and helpful.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Fortner.  Please contact my store to discuss your package.  Was it delivered direct to your home by UPS or was it picked up at my store?  We will be happy to get you to the right people to discuss.  205-980-8180, Keith

name: Melissa Dixon
text: Keith Sides and his employees are fantastic. I use them for all of my mailing needs, fingerprinting, and greeting card purchases. I'm always greeted by a smiling face, and the services is worth more than five stars.

text: Had the pleasure of spending almost one hpur speaking with Keith, the Owner of this UPS Store tonight. I arrived as the clock struck 6:30 pm (Closing Time) to pick up some print media for our Bakery, as someone outsourced our Order and I had no idea what to expect re: the finished product. Mr. Sides was laid back, personable and our product looks fantastic. He not only won my business moving forward but I will be using Keith and this (specific) UPS Store (although it is a good 20-25 minutes outside of the way) in the future for custom orders relative to our Brand. A+

text: I had a commissioned painting I needed shipped to my sister in NC.  The crew at Caldwell Mill UPS Store took great care in packaging the painting and it arrived in tact and exactly on time. text: This is my favorite UPS Store and I will drive out of my way to go here because of the great customer service. Zared, the front counter manager, is amazing. resp.text: Cameron....thank you very much for your kind review and for being a loyal customer.  We try to make sure every customer feels unique and that we always provide excellent service.  Zared, and the rest of her team at the front counter, work hard and do an awesome job!  Keith

text: I love this place.  They are friendly, helpful, and efficient!  Mailing a package is never a hassle, and ithe store is in a very convenient location -- easy to get in and out of quickly.

name: Andy Entrekin
text: Friendly and knowledgeable staff. They took care of me!

name: Leslie Cremer
text: The best place to go for shipping needs!  The people here are always nice and willing to help. If I ever got to the point where I lived farther away I would drive all that way to get there.

resp.text: Leslie...I apologize for the late response but we certainly appreciate your vote of confidence.  Our counter staff works hard to provide excellent service each and every day.  Please, if you ever do move further away, always come back to see us.  Keith

name: Ella Fulcher
text: I had some plates that got shattered during shipment and a package that got labeled wrong.  I called the store and spoke with Zared who looked into my shipment and helped me return the wrong package and is working on getting me refunded for the plates.  Zared has been super helpful and sweet as we work through getting things processed and together.

resp.text: Ella....Thank you for your kind words about the service provided by Zared.  She and all our staff have the goal of providing the best in customer service.  While accidents do happen, we are always ready and willing to do whatever it takes to make it right.

name: Glenn Mazer
text: I could not submit another review so I'm editing a previous one to respond to Gabriel's review left a few days ago because it is not indicative of the UPS Store, the staff, or it's owner. She writes, "What good is the UPS store if I can’t ship postal packages.. just one more inconvenience because people can’t do their jobs right!!!" This review needs to be directed to the USPS, not the UPS store, she named the wrong entity in her review. She is correct about people not doing their job because that's the very reason the UPS store stopped taking prepaid USPS packages, because the USPS can't do their job. They lose packages, packages are delayed because they can't do their job and the UPS store should not have to take the blame for the USPS inadequate culture. So guess what? They don't have to take any more of the blame because they can't provide an accommodation for a service that is so inept in which they get blamed for. I am in this store just about everyday to get my mail. Regardless of how busy the staff is, I’m always treated with, “hello Mr. Mazer.” Zared and her crew are the most dedicated, service oriented people I’ve ever encountered. They get bombarded with shipping and packaging around this time of year, but they don’t change their demeanor. Keith, the owner, is a great guy and it’s no wonder why he has great people working for him. It is because he knows how to treat people and how people want to be treated. For that person that upgraded her one star to three stars, shame on you for blaming these fine folks for your ignorance.

resp.text: Glenn....always a pleasure to see you and thank you for your kind words.  I am blessed with good people whose goal is always to help our customers whether it be shipping, printing or any other of our business services.  If ever we fail to live up to your expectations - let me know - we'll make it right!  Keith

name: Jennifer Henshaw
text: Devon is an amazing employee! She stayed late to help me out and is very quick with her job! I think that's how she spelled her name but didn't get a good look. 10/10 for her!

resp.text: Jennifer....Thank you for your kind comments regarding Devyn.  She, and all our staff, hope to provide the best in customer service.  We are here to be of help any time we can.

name: Bryan Kirkland
text: Victoria was very helpful and patient with my products that had to be shipped. It's not everyday a racing wheelchair with two sets of wheels are shipped but she handled it like a pro and beyond pleasant to talk to. She listened to what I explained to her about how to package the carbon fiber wheels so that they wouldn't  get damaged from the axel's touching one another. I was dreading the process but came out of it with a smile on my face.

name: Mary Waldman
text:
I was charged a $20 rush fee for a small photocopy print job I submitted the day before. When I questioned the charge, I was told that same day photocopying was considered a rush. I pointed out that I had submitted the job the day before - I'd called the shop to make sure the email had come through and the clerk said the copy shop had left early. The best the manager could do was a 15% discount on the rush fee. I asked where this policy was noted and the staff had to dig out a notebook page buried on a back counter (that didn't list the policy). I just checked the website and there's no mention of rush charges, or even print prices.
(Update: this review started as a 1-star but I have changed it to a 3-star based on the managers quick response and offer to ameliorate the situation.)

resp.text:
Good morning....thank you for your comments and I want to start off by apologizing for the confusion on the rush fee.  We had understood the items were needed by 4:30pm that day and, as such, a rush fee would normally apply for same day jobs handled by our print department.  My apologies that you did not receive a quote before we proceeded on the job which would have outlined all charges and requested your approval to proceed.

Because of our error and because we value each customer’s business and their satisfaction with our work, I want to offer a cash refund to you for the rush fee or a print credit to be used on a future job.  We hope to see you again and trust you will find our service level improved.

Keith Sides

name: Jamie White
text: Keith at the UPS store on Caldwell Mill Road does a terrific job! His employees are always friendly and fast. I would recommend you use THIS UPS store for all of your printing needs.

name: Daniel Gallegly
text:
Keith grew a beard. I thought he was in the witness protection program when I ran into him. But he looks sharp and distinguished with the new look.

He has a great local print and ship shop that always did a good job for us and their people behind the counter have great attitudes and are really helpful and nice.

Good turn around and design quality always looks good. Keith runs a tight ship even with a beard.

name: Johnny Carcioppolo
text: This is the place to go for your printing needs!!! Colby and Donna did an amazing job for me in a pinch. The price was right and the service was outstanding. We even had one small issue and without a second thought they took care of everything in record time. If you have printing needs and you want reliable, cost efficient, professional and friendly service this is where you need to go. I will certainly have them do much more of my printing now.

name: A Robin
text: The sign on the door says "We're open".  They closed early today at noon.  They are closed.  The Inverness location is still open and has regular business hours.

resp.text: Hi...I'm sorry we missed you.  As the virus epidemic unfolded we were attempting to adjust hours for the safety of our employees and convenience of our customers.  I'm glad our Inverness store was able to assist you.

name: Daniel Gallegly
text:
These people do a GREAT JOB. The owner, Keith, and his team are very professional, and I was pleasantly surprised at the many different services that they offer. This store also has a printing department, which has done a great job printing all of our materials. The quality of the graphic design is also very strong.

I highly recommend the UPS Store on Caldwell Mill Road!!

name: Christy McDonald
text: Colby Green at the UPS STORE on Caldwell Mill RD truly is awesome!  He makes everything so easy.  The quality and price is definitely better than anywhere I've checked.  I've used them for business cards, post card mailers, stationary, stickers and etc.  Give them a shot, you won't regret it!

name: Tessie Barrett
text: Colby and the guys at UPS are awesome! They have made name tags, yard signs, business cards (in an hours notice.... ). Truly amazing. I highly recommend them to anyone.  Also ask about their flyer mail outs! Good stuff.

name: Joshua Winn
text: Have printing, shipping, labeling, storage needs? Colby Green and all of the folks at Store 2389 are the best in the business! They can take care of your needs, and are great when it comes to answering all your questions. They really do a fantastic job. Could not recommend anyone in their line of work more highly!

name: Brice Jackson
text: I use Caldwell Mill UPS Store for my Print! They always do an excellent job in a timely manner! Staff is knowledgeable & helpful. They respond quickly to email and a delight to work with.

name: Woodie Westbrook
text: Great service, helpful staff.  The manager seemed very knowledgeable and was willing to work with me to help with a lot of last minute printing.  I couldn't recommend them a enough.  Any time I am in Birmingham this is where I will go.

name: Down In Front Productions LLC
text: The BEST printers in the area. They have helped us with numerous projects on a tight timeline and have more than satisfied us every single time! We highly recommend them!

name: Connie Johnston
text: As a local business owner, I highly recommend UPS Store 2389 for their advertising and printing services.  Their knowledgeable staff is friendly and very helpful.  The graphic designers are great to work with and the turnaround time is super quick. I used to order my printed products online, but now I exclusively use the UPS Store 2389.

name: Glyna Humm
text: I pass other UPS stores to come to this one! They have fantastic service and offer more printing services than the others. I love that I can email the job I need done and they do all the work. They always call me immediately when it is complete.

name: Nimes Dill
text: Same day business cards are awesome! Colby does a wonderful job getting you taken care of.

name: Joseph Hope
text: Great place to do business. They offer tons of helpful services!

name: RLK Designs, LLC
text: Sarah and Jessica are extremely talented graphic artists, and, more importantly, very nice ladies.  They are the reasons we love getting cards, prints, and signs at UPS Caldwell Mill.  Thank you!

name: Joseph Gray
text: The staff here always has a smile on. One in particular who always helps me out has a bright smile and her happy attitude is infectious.

resp.text: Thank you, sir, for you kind comments regarding our staff.  We always strive to provide efficient and friendly service.

name: Laura Gardner
text: This store makes sure to get the job done right and really knows how to take care of their customers! Colby is great to work with!

name: Cassidy Waddell
text: The employees are so polite and attentive. Customer service is top notch and store is very clean!

name: Fara Poe
text: Always fast service, no matter if it is shipping or copy services.  They even offered "consultation" for the best paper choice for my last copy/print job.

name: Jason Watson
text: Colby and the whole staff at this store will follow you throughout the process and put what you want where you want it. Great experience every time I go in the store.

name: Jason Hamer
text: They provide more services than what I thought. Great Store, Service and Staff!

name: Cheryl Ringuette Lewis
text: Terrific people, fast friendly service, this place just can't be beat!

name: Nicholas Johnson
text: Great staff always willing to help and they will work with you to make sure you are happy and return. That is hard to find now a days.

name: Tim Ryner
text: Great service and friendly staff. Would use their services again.

name: Linda
text: Rude!  Just looked at me when I came in. No can I help you are anything.  We just stood looking as each other. Rude. Bad customer service.

name: Angela Studdard
text: Very professional and quality service.

name: Georgia S
text: Always SUPER nice and EXTREMELY helpful!

name: Paris Fuller
text: Melissa was great and very professional! She definitely made my experience memorable.

name: Ken Kobayashi
text: This location is obviously understaffed, to the point where it can't be relied upon to be open during its stated business hours. I've never had this problem with the other FedEx Office location nearby (4711 University Dr).

name: Mila Zsidisin
text: This is a very nice place to ship! Alice and all the staff is great! ALWAYS helpful, attentive, polite.  all who works there are highly qualified specialists. I would highly recommend this office!

name: Anthony Leach
text: Kareem, the manager, got me in and out with no complaints. Thank you for your professionalism.

name: LISA GARCIA
text:
Melissa was so helpful and wonderful helping me print important documents.
Will definitely come back because of her.

name: Word-Xpress LLC
text: Friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable staff! Thank God for them.  All other print service stores  in town drive me nuts!

name: Torey Lavish
text: Melissa did a wonderful job getting me in and out quickly and helping me with a return! This will be my go-to mailing center now.

name: Brittany
text: Came here to ship a package. Great customer service, was in and out in under 3 minutes.

name: Jessica Polk
text: I use this place frequently, and i really enjoy the staff they are very professional.

name: Michelle Bergh
text: Terrible customer service.   Store manager was very rude & condescending to myself & other customers in the store at the time. I was just printing out some papers, was never even acknowledged or offered help. When I did ask for help was treated rudely almost as if I was an annoyance. Will never set foot in this store again.

name: James Burton
text: I've never had to wait here. Great place.

name: Blake Hargrove
text: Friendly staff that took care of me right away.

name: Jeff Peterson
text:
If you're looking for honest service and a helpful staff - GO ELSEWHERE.

After a relative passed away, I packaged and shipped five boxes to our home across the country.  We told the employee that we wanted the most economical option - the contents were valuable and needed insurance (china, books, birdhouse, rug, etc.), but speed was not a concern.  We were told 3 day residential was the cheapest option.

One of the five boxes was completely crushed during shipment and several china pieces were broken despite purchasing nearly $100 of bubble wrap and china specific packaging supplies.  I filed a claim with UPS, provided pictures, etc.  Without inspecting the box, UPS ultimately denied the claim because there was a sweater in the package that I'd sent in the box to free up room for stuff in my luggage.  UPS claimed it was inappropriate packaging material even though it was just part of the contents.  UPS would not discuss the denial with me because UPS deemed the UPS Store as the shipper (not me).

During the claims process, I found out that ground service was available and would have been ~$200 less expensive.

I called the UPS store and spoke to the manager.  I started by telling her about the insurance denial.  She said it was not their issue since they didn't package the box.  I agreed, but told her UPS will only speak with them (as the shipper) and that they needed to act on my behalf to help resolve the issue.  I next mentioned that we could have shipped the boxes via ground for less money and that staff misled us.  She became INCREDIBLY RUDE and told me the staff just recommended that service - not that it wasn't the cheapest option.  I pushed back and asked if she was present at the time of the transaction - she said no.  With no knowledge of the interaction, she continued to blindly and aggressively tell me what her staff said and did.  It was clear the conversation was going nowhere.

A manager from a different location called later.  She said they'd file an appeal with UPS on our behalf.  No followup occurred.

I rarely get fired up, but this experience was AWFUL!  The staff misled and overcharged us.  UPS denied a claim without ever inspecting the box.  UPS would not speak to me despite my family boxing, shipping, paying for and receiving the boxes.  The manager was incredibly rude.  They were unhelpful and failed to help resolve the claim with UPS.

This is a great store if this is the service you're looking for.

To make it even worse, as I was filing the dispute with UPS (which took hours and multiple calls), I contacted the UPS Store to get copies of our receipt.  They were helpful and said they'd send over the receipts.  Instead of sending our receipt, they accidentally emailed me a copy of another customer's DRIVERS LICENSE and SOCIAL SECURITY CARD.  I guess you can add careless to the list too.....

FIND ANOTHER WAY/LOCATION TO SHIP YOUR UPS PACKAGES!

name: Ben Brady
text: rude Cheryl going to fedex

resp.text: Hi, and thank you for visiting our store. We apologize if you had a bad experience in our store. We invite you back to further discuss what happened and to see what actions need to be taken. Maybe there was just a misunderstanding. Please contact us at your earliest convenience.

name: Don Hembree
text: Worst UPS service center experience I’ve ever had. Went in for a simple drop off of a Verizon phone return using the Verizon provided box and shipping label and the owner/attendant  require that I buy a new box from him before shipping. Took to another UPS location and dropped off with no problem.  This is obviously a scam

resp.text: We apologize about your experience in our store. We do invite you back in to better address the situation. Policy states that USPS packaging are for USPS shipping only depending on their service, UPS Express packaging is for UPS Express Services only, and FedEx packaging is for FedEx services only. Thank you!

name: Nicole Smith
text: Went in to this location today at 5:30pm because I needed to give my fingerprints for some documents, when I went in a blonde haired lady with her hair pulled in a high bun who wore glasses  asked what I needed and I told her I needed to give my fingerprints, she then proceeded to tell me they quit doing prints at 5 which is not a big deal I would have came back tomorrow, I was curious as to why they quit taking fingerprints at 5 so I asked the lady, she then said “because we do!” I thought I misinterpreted what she said so I said “I’m sorry did you say because we do” her reply was yup. I asked the lady to speak to a manager she said there wasn’t one there so I asked her name and she stated Cheryl. I was in such shock that she was that rude, I will be contacting management or higher up in the morning! That is just no way to treat customers and is highly upsetting that someone who works with the public doesn’t know how to deal with the public. Terrible customer service!!!!!

resp.text: We do apologize for the way our employee has treated you on your last visit. The real reason we stop doing fingerprints after 5pm is because we try to have two or more employees on the floor, one to assist our fingerprint customers when they come in and one to handle other customers with their needs. We do invite you to come back in to talk with us about redeeming this experience. Thank you!

name: Scotty Stimpson
text: I come to this location all the time to return my Amazon orders. The staff is always professional and the returns go smoothly! Will continue coming!

resp.text: Thank you for your continued patronage!

name: That One No one
text: Best of all in the area!!!

resp.text: Thank you for this review!!!

name: RFG
text: Went to get some documents notarized, staff were prompt, patient, helpful and polite. Great service.

resp.text: Thank you for your visit! We look forward to seeing you again.

name: Anna Ryan
text: Had a package returned with broken items and items missing. Everything left in the package was dirty and in bad condition. The employee was unwilling to do anything about it because I "packaged the box myself." Can't believe they would treat costumers' packages so poorly and offer nothing to fix the problem. Waste of money and time to use this store.

name: John Roberson
text: Great service!

name: Martin Jaramillo
text: I have no reason not to give less tan five stars, it has been as expected every time I've been there.

name: Taylor Allen
text: Horrible customer service. Never going here again. The "manager" was rude and tried to make me feel incompetent. She was condescending and really didn't care to help me. Only concerned with hurrying me out the door to "assist" the next customer. The other woman was nice and pleasant though.

name: AWAKEN Student Ministries
text: Great Customer service, always friendly and willing to Go the extra mile!!!

name: Harmony Love
text:
The African American manager was very rude and unfriendly to his employees and to the customers!

I return packages all the time to Amazon and I never pay a dime.

This representative made me pay $12 for PACKAGING!!!

resp.text:
I would first like to apologize if I came off abrasive or seemed short with anyone. That was not my intention. There were several factors at play and maybe my directness was not well received.
Unfortunately, your Amazon return was not covered for The UPS Store to pack and ship. Yes, Amazon covered your shipping, but they did not cover your packaging. Not all Amazon returns are free returns. Not all Amazon returns are covered for The UPS Store to pack and ship. A shipping label only covers shipping costs. It does not cover packaging. Also, I did not make you pay for packaging. I said if you wish for us to package your return, then it was going to be $12. I do invite you back to our location for a more personal apology and to possibly review this incident to come to a better understanding.

name: Kelley Anderson
text: I had prompt, friendly, competent service. Sign on the door says under new management; that might explain the poor reviews from earlier.

name: Chase Walley
text: These people are Jerks.  I stood in the store for 10+ minutes before the staff even spoke to me.  I waited my turn and still ended up leaving because of LACK of customer service!   I would not recommend this place to anyone.

name: blake myers
text: Very poor customer service!!!   Ruined a print that my mom mailed to me.   The manager was very rude and never apologized for packing wrong.   I will not use them ever again and I will go to FEDEX for future service.   Poor, Poor Customer Service and I would not recommend them for future service.

name: Jalexia Collins
text: Rude employees!! UPS is the worst delivery service!!

name: Virginia Patterson
text: Service was very fast and easy

name: Thomas Holman
text: Just watched the HBO special. Hope the business is successful!

name: Michael Booker
text: What an awesome concept and place! Clean, neat, professional! Sara is super helpful. So glad we found this place!

name: Vic Robertson
text: Great merchandise, great prices, friendly and fast service.
